{
  "article_text": [
    "the response of superconducting films to homogeneous applied magnetic fields is well understood , and analytic expressions for the distributions of the magnetic field and current density have been derived  @xcite based on bean s critical state model .",
    "@xcite when small current - carrying coils are placed near the surface to probe the local properties of superconducting films , the magnetic fields generated by the coils are inhomogeneous .",
    "analytic expressions describing the response of superconducting films to small coils have been derived for the linear response regime ,  @xcite but in order to measure the local distribution of the critical current density @xmath2 in superconducting films , it is necessary to investigate the nonlinear response .",
    "@xcite numerical computations of the nonlinear response of superconducting films to the inhomogeneous magnetic fields arising from small coils have been carried out in refs .  , but here we present analytic results for the nonlinear response to line currents above superconducting films .    the procedure proposed by claassen _",
    "et al . _",
    "@xcite for inductive measurements of the local @xmath2 distribution in films of thickness much greater than the london penetration depth @xmath7 can be described briefly as follows .",
    "a small coil carrying a sinusoidal drive current @xmath8 is placed just above a superconducting film , and the induced voltage @xmath9 in the coil is detected .",
    "the amplitude of the third - harmonic voltage @xmath10 is measured as a function of the drive current amplitude @xmath4 , and the threshold current @xmath11 is defined such that @xmath12 for @xmath13 and @xmath14 for @xmath15 . because @xmath6 , where @xmath3 the film thickness , @xmath2 can be evaluated from @xmath11 .",
    "@xcite since an electric - field criterion must be applied for a precise determination of @xmath2 , it is important to evaluate the electric field @xmath16 generated in the superconducting film .  @xcite    in the present paper we consider linear wires as simple models of coil wires , and we analytically investigate the response of a superconducting film to linear wires carrying transport currents . in sec .",
    "[ sec_single - wire ]",
    "we investigate the dc ( ac ) response of a superconducting film to a linear wire carrying a dc ( ac ) transport current : we determine the threshold current @xmath11 , and we present the voltage @xmath17 and the harmonic voltages induced in the linear wire , as well as the electric field @xmath16 induced in the superconducting film . in sec .",
    "[ sec_two - wires ] we consider a superconducting film and two linear wires carrying transport currents of opposite directions .",
    "we briefly summarize our results in sec .",
    "[ sec_conclusion ] .",
    "in this section we consider a superconducting film and a linear wire carrying a transport current , as shown in fig .",
    "[ fig_sc - wire ] .     and a linear wire at @xmath18 .",
    "the film is infinitely extended in the @xmath19 plane , and the infinite wire is parallel to the @xmath20 axis . ]    an infinitely long wire , parallel to the @xmath20 axis , is situated at @xmath18 where @xmath21 .",
    "the radius of the wire @xmath22 is assumed to be much smaller than @xmath23 .",
    "a superconducting film , infinitely extended in the @xmath19 plane , is situated at @xmath24 , where the film thickness @xmath3 is much smaller than @xmath23 but is larger than the london penetration depth @xmath7 .",
    "flux pinning in the film is characterized by the critical current density @xmath2 , which is assumed to be constant ( independent of magnetic field ) as in bean s critical state model  @xcite and to be spatially homogeneous in the film .",
    "we consider the limit @xmath25 , as this simplification allows us to obtain simple analytic expressions for the magnetic - field and current distributions . in the thin - film limit of @xmath25 , the sheet current",
    "@xmath26 plays crucial roles , and the upper limit of @xmath5 is the critical sheet - current density @xmath1 .",
    "the lower critical field @xmath27 is assumed to be much smaller than @xmath1 ( i.e. , @xmath28 ) , such that the flux penetration into superconducting films is not affected by @xmath27 , but is determined by @xmath1 .",
    "@xcite    we introduce the complex field @xmath29 ,  @xcite which is an analytic function of @xmath30 for @xmath31 and @xmath32 .",
    "the biot - savart law for the complex field is given by @xmath33 where @xmath34 is the complex field arising from the line current alone .",
    "the @xmath34 is given by @xmath35 where @xmath36 is the transport current flowing in the linear wire .",

    "the magnetic flux per unit length @xmath45 around the linear wire is @xmath46 .",

    "harmonic voltages induced in coils are detected .",
    "@xcite for precise @xmath2 measurements , it also is important to determine the electric field induced in the film .",
    "@xcite    we wish to calculate the magnetic field around the linear wire @xmath98 , defined by eq .  , and the voltage per unit length induced in the wire , @xmath99 where @xmath100 is the resistance per unit length of the wire .",

    "[ sec_dc - linear ] .",

    "for @xmath105 , the harmonic voltages , the magnetic flux per unit length penetrating the film @xmath106 , and the electric field in the film @xmath16 are all zero .",
    "@xcite      for @xmath15 , on the other hand , the magnetic field penetrates through the superconducting film , as discussed in sec .",

    "@xcite the maximum electric field is induced just below the linear wire at @xmath121 , and is given approximately by @xmath122 for @xmath123 .",
    "the voltage per unit length induced in the linear wire can be expressed as the fourier series @xmath124 where the amplitude @xmath125 and phase difference @xmath126 of the @xmath127th harmonics are calculated by @xmath128 because of the periodicity of @xmath129 , the even harmonics are zero ; i.e. , @xmath130 for @xmath131 .",
    "the fundamental voltage @xmath132 is simply determined by the resistance per unit length of the linear wire , the self - inductance per unit length of the wire , and the mutual inductance per unit length between the wire and its image .",
    "we are interested in the odd harmonics of @xmath133 for @xmath134 ; they are obtained by substituting eqs .   and into eq .  , which yields @xmath135 where @xmath136 .",
    "for@xmath137 we have @xmath138    figure  [ fig_v3-q3-i0 ] shows the @xmath4 dependence of the third - harmonic voltage @xmath139 calculated from eq .   with @xmath140 .",
    "although the present model of a linear wire is oversimplified , the behavior of the third harmonic voltage shown in this figure qualitatively agrees with the experimental data measured by a coil with a @xmath141 film .",

    "here we discuss the more realistic situation of experiments detecting the response of a superconducting film to a circular current - carrying coil .",
    "@xcite we consider a single - turn coil parallel to a superconducting film .",
    "when the radius of the coil is @xmath191 and the distance between the coil and the film is @xmath23 , the configuration of the coil and the film in the @xmath192 plane is similar to that in fig .",
    "[ fig_sc-2wires ] .",
    "we expect that the magnetic - field lines , the magnetic - field component perpendicular to the film , and the circular sheet - current distribution in the film then will be similar to the corresponding quantities shown in fig .  [ fig_field - lines-2wires ] .    in actual superconducting films the critical current density @xmath2 and the film thickness @xmath3 can be inhomogeneous , although in the present paper we assumed that @xmath193 is spatially homogeneous .",
    "the magnetic field produced by the coil of radius @xmath191 is largest directly below the coil ( i.e. , the circular region of radius @xmath194 in the film ) when @xmath195 .",
    "if @xmath193 in the circular region below the coil is nearly homogeneous , the response of the film will be similar to that presented in sec .",
    "[ sec_two - wires ] , and the signal in the coil will yield the local value of @xmath193 . in this sense",
    "the resolution of the measurements using the coil is on the order of @xmath191 .",
    "however , if @xmath193 is very inhomogeneous within the circular region below the coil , the response of the film will be quite different from that given in sec .",
    "[ sec_two - wires ] .",
    "we investigated the response of an infinite superconducting film at @xmath51 to linear wires above the film carrying transport currents @xmath36 .",
    "we derived analytic expressions for the complex field , and these are given in eqs .",
    ", , , and .",
    "the behavior of the film can be summarized as follows .",
    "\\(i ) response to a dc current , @xmath196 : for a small dc current in the range @xmath197 , the sheet - current density @xmath0 in the film is less than the critical value @xmath1 , and no magnetic field penetrates into the region @xmath198 below the film .",
    "however , for a large dc current @xmath15 , the sheet - current density reaches @xmath199 and the magnetic field penetrates into the region below the film .",
    "\\(ii ) response to an ac current , @xmath200 : for @xmath13 the voltage @xmath17 induced in the linear wire has only the first harmonic at the fundamental frequency @xmath201 .",
    "however , for @xmath15 , odd - harmonic voltages with frequency @xmath202 , @xmath127 = 3 , 5 , 7 , ... , are also induced in the linear wire .",
    "the complex field for the case of a single current - carrying linear wire above the film is derived in appendix a. the complex field for the case of a pair of current - carrying wires in a plane perpendicular ( parallel ) to the film is given in appendix b ( appendix c ) .",
    "we thank h.  yamasaki for stimulating discussions . this manuscript has been authored in part by iowa state university of science and technology under contract no .",

    "department of energy .",

    "we present here the complex field for a superconducting film with two parallel linear wires above it .",
    "an infinite superconducting film is in the plane @xmath51 , as shown in fig .",
    "[ fig_sc - wire ] .",

    "in this appendix we derive eqs .  . consider the function @xmath260 defined by @xmath261           \\phi(\\zeta ) ,   \\label{f(z)}\\ ] ] where @xmath262 and @xmath263 are defined by eqs .   and , respectively .",
    "we calculate the integral @xmath264 along the closed contour @xmath223 shown in fig .",
    "[ fig_contour ] , as in eq .  , @xmath265 where the contour integral along the infinite circle vanishes because @xmath266 for @xmath226 .",
    "because the integrand on the left - hand side of eq .   has poles at @xmath227 , @xmath267 , and @xmath268 , the contour integral of eq .   can be calculated by using the residue theorem , as @xmath269 , and thus yielding @xmath270 the @xmath271 is defined by @xmath272   \\nonumber\\\\      & = & \\frac{i_0}{2\\pi }           \\left [ \\frac{\\zeta\\phi(\\zeta_1)}{\\zeta^2-\\zeta_1 ^ 2 }           -\\frac{\\zeta\\phi(\\zeta_2)}{\\zeta^2-\\zeta_2 ^ 2 } \\right ] ,   \\label{f0(z)}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where we used @xmath273 and @xmath274 .    for @xmath233 , eq .",

    "the flux - penetration process for finite @xmath296 is more complicated than that shown in the present paper for @xmath28 .",
    "the case for @xmath296 will be published elsewhere , j. r. clem and y. mawatari , unpublished .",
    "j. r. clem , r. p. huebener , and d. e. gallus , j. low temp .",
    "* 12 * , 449 ( 1973 ) .",
    "e. zeldov , a. i. larkin , v. b. geshkenbein , m. konczykowski , d. majer , b. khaykovich , v. m. vinokur , and h. shtrikman , , 1428 ( 1994 ) . y. mawatari and j. r. clem , phys .",
    "* 86 * , 2870 ( 2001 ) ; a. a. babaei brojeny , y. mawatari , m. benkraouda , and j. r. clem , supercond .",
    "* 15 * , 1454 ( 2002 ) ; y. mawatari and j. r. clem , , 024505 ( 2003 ) .",
    "note that the simple result of @xmath297 for @xmath13 is ideally accurate only for the thin - film limit , @xmath25 .",
    "small but finite magnitudes of @xmath298 and @xmath299 arise even for @xmath13 in a superconducting film of finite thickness , because the magnetic flux penetrates in the vicinity of the upper surface of the film .",
    "we confine our attention here to low frequencies , well below those normally used to investigate the surface resistance of superconducting films , where energy dissipation arises due to excitation of quasiparticles or to small - amplitude vortex motion , as discussed , for example , in m. w. coffey and j. r. clem , , 386 ( 1991 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we theoretically investigate the response of a superconducting film to line currents flowing in linear wires placed above the film , and we present analytic expressions for the magnetic - field and current distributions based on the critical state model . </S>",
    "<S> the behavior of the superconducting film is characterized by the sheet - current density @xmath0 , whose magnitude can not exceed the critical value @xmath1 , where @xmath2 is the critical current density and @xmath3 is the thickness of the film . </S>",
    "<S> when the transport current @xmath4 flowing in the wire is small enough , @xmath5 is smaller than @xmath1 and the magnetic field is shielded below the film . </S>",
    "<S> when @xmath4 exceeds a threshold value @xmath6 , on the other hand , @xmath5 reaches @xmath1 and the magnetic field penetrates below the film . </S>",
    "<S> we also calculate the ac response of the film when an ac transport current flows in the linear wires . </S>"
  ]
}
